command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $domain='example.com'; $out='C:\ProgramData\recon\riskiq_subdomains_example.com.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path C:\ProgramData\recon | Out-Null; $log='C:\ProgramData\recon\recon.log'; try { $user=$env:PT_USER; $key=$env:PT_KEY; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($user) -or [string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($key)){ throw 'PassiveTotal credentials not set'; } $token=[Convert]::ToBase64String([Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes("$user`:$key")); $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Basic $token"; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $uri="https://api.riskiq.net/pt/v2/enrichment/subdomains/lookup/$domain"; $resp=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Get -UseBasicParsing -TimeoutSec 45 -ErrorAction Stop; if(($resp.StatusCode -ge 200) -and ($resp.StatusCode -lt 300) -and ($resp.Headers['Content-Type'] -match 'application/json')){ ($resp.Content | ConvertFrom-Json) | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 | Set-Content -Path $out -Encoding UTF8 } else { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) PassiveTotal non-success or non-JSON for $domain. Status=$($resp.StatusCode)" } } catch { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) PassiveTotal error for $domain: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Uses authenticated access to RiskIQ PassiveTotal (a closed-source, subscription intelligence platform) to enumerate subdomains and store results as JSON.
rationale_steps: Build Basic Auth header from credentials stored in environment variables.
Query the closed-source enrichment endpoint for subdomains.
Validate response headers and status, then parse and write JSON.
Record any exceptions to a log file without leaking secrets.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper syntax, balanced quotes/braces, correct error handling, appropriate variable declarations, and proper API request formatting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by authenticating to RiskIQ PassiveTotal (a paid threat intelligence platform), querying for subdomain information about a target domain, and storing the results for later use in targeting.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed, with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid flag formats, and correct syntax for all operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent by using authenticated access to RiskIQ PassiveTotal, a closed-source subscription intelligence platform, to gather subdomains, directly aligning with the 'Search Closed Sources' technique (T1597).

llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It authentically queries a closed-source (RiskIQ PassiveTotal) API with credentials to enumerate subdomains and store JSON, aligning with T1597, though the specific endpoint path may be slightly off depending on current API conventions.
